Package model

Class Model

java.lang.Object
model.Model
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Model extends Object implements Serializable
This class stores and maintains user/app data and provides tools for interacting with the database through the DB class. The data this class manages are as follows:
  • User Data: Favorites List, Virtual Pantry
  • Application Data: List of all ingredients in the database
The interactions between the application and database allowed by this class are:
  • Searching for recipes by recipe name (standard search)
  • Searching for recipes based on ingredients (pantry search)
Author:
Katherine Wilson, Zachary Empkey
See Also:
  • GUI

    • allIngredients

      private ArrayList<String> allIngredients
      List of all ingredients across all recipes in the database. They are stored in title case as Strings.

  • Constructor Details

    • Model

      public Model()
      Creates a Model object. If a user data file exists ("user_data.dat") in this project's directory, then its data will be loaded into this object. If not, a blank Model will be created.

    • Model

      public Model(boolean testing)
      Creates a Model that skips the initialization of user data. This is used solely for testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      testing - Parameter used to set this testing constructor apart from the real one. Its value is arbitrary.

  • Method Details

    • initializeUserData

      private void initializeUserData()
      Initializes the favorites list and virtual pantry from the user data file. These will be stored as favorites and pantryList respectively.
      See Also:
      • DATA_FILE_NAME

    • initializeIngredients

      private void initializeIngredients()
      Initializes the list of all ingredients in the database (allIngredients) from the "ingredients.txt" file.

    • saveUserData

      public void saveUserData()
      Saves the user's favorites list (favorites) and virtual pantry (pantryList) to the user data file ("user_data.dat").
      This should be called whenever the user exits the application to make sure the data from their current session is not lost.

    • searchDatabase

      public Recipe[] searchDatabase(String keyword)
      Uses the db class to search the database for recipes with names that match the given query.
      Parameters:
      keyword - Search query to send to database.
      Returns:
      a list of recipe search results.

    • getFavorites

      public ArrayList<Recipe> getFavorites()
      Returns the user's list of favorites (favorites).
      Returns:
      the user's favorites list as a List of Recipe objects.

    • addToFavorites

      public void addToFavorites(Recipe recipe)
      Adds the given recipe to the user's favorites list.
      Parameters:
      recipe - Recipe to add to the user's favorites list.

    • removeFromFavorites

      public void removeFromFavorites(Recipe recipe)
      Removes the given recipe from the user's favorites list.
      Parameters:
      recipe - Recipe to remove from the user's favorites list.

    • moveFavoriteUp

      public void moveFavoriteUp(Recipe recipe)
      Moves a favorite up by one index in the user's favorites list.
      Parameters:
      recipe - Recipe to move up.

    • moveFavoriteDown

      public void moveFavoriteDown(Recipe recipe)
      Moves a favorite down by one index in the user's favorites list.
      Parameters:
      recipe - Recipe to move down.

    • getAllIngredients

      public List<String> getAllIngredients()
      Returns a list of all ingredients across all recipes in the database.
      Returns:
      the list of all ingredients as Strings.

    • getPantry

      public List<String> getPantry()
      Returns the user's "virtual pantry".
      Returns:
      the list of ingredients in the user's pantry as Strings.

    • addPantryItem

      public boolean addPantryItem(String item)
      Adds an ingredient to the user's "virtual pantry" (pantryList).
      This function assumes the given ingredient is in allIngredients.
      Parameters:
      item - Ingredient to add to the pantry.
      Returns:
      true if the ingredient was successfully added or
      false if the pantry already contains the ingredient.

    • removePantryItem

      public void removePantryItem(String item)
      Removes an ingredient from the user's "virtual pantry". (pantryList).
      This function assumes the given ingredient is in allIngredients.
      Parameters:
      item - Ingredient to remove from the pantry.

    • searchWithPantry

      public List<Recipe> searchWithPantry()
      Uses the db class to perform a "pantry search". This is a search for recipes that the user can make based on the ingredients in their pantry.
      Returns:
      A list of recipes the user can make with what's in their virtual pantry.

    • titleCase

      private String titleCase(String str)
      Converts the given String to title case. This function will ignore quotation marks at the beginning of the String and capitalize the first letter it finds.
      Parameters:
      str - String to be converted to title case.
      Returns:
      the given String in title case.
